attributes.name: data-zui-alert-timeout
attributes.description: When this attribute is set, it will close the alert after the given timeout. The value is in milliseconds.

attributes.name: data-zui-alert-fade-speed
attributes.description: When the data-zui-alert-fade-speed attribute is set, it will be used as the fadeout speed. The value is in milliseconds.

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: Depending on the type of alert the role attribute must be set. If the alert is an information message, the role attribute must be set to status. If the alert is a dangerous message or a warning message, the role attribute must be set to alert.

classes.name: zui-alert
classes.description: The zui-alert class identifies an HTML element as an alert.The zui-alert class identifies an HTML element as an alert.

classes.name: zui-alert-danger
classes.description: The zui-alert-danger class should be set on the same element that has the zui-alert class set. By setting the zui-alert-danger class you identity the alert as a dangerous message.

classes.name: zui-alert-subtle
classes.description: The zui-alert-subtle class should be set on the same element that has the zui-alert class set. By setting the zui-alert-subtle class you identity the alert as a subtle message.

classes.name: zui-alert-success
classes.description: The zui-alert-success class should be set on the same element that has the zui-alert class set. By setting the zui-alert-success class you identity the alert as a successful message.

classes.name: zui-alert-title
classes.description: The zui-alert-title class should be set on the element that acts as the title of an alert.

classes.name: zui-alert-warning
classes.description: The zui-alert-warning class should be set on the same element that has the zui-alert class set. By setting the zui-alert-warning class you identity the alert as a warning.

events.name: zui-alert-closed
events.description: The event that is triggered once an alert is closed.
